sn46.17:1.1: “Mendicants, when these seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated they lead to going from the near shore to the far shore.
sn46.17:1.3: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.
sn46.17:1.4: These seven awakening factors, when developed and cultivated, lead to going from the near shore to the far shore.
sn46.17:2.2: who cross to the far shore.
sn46.17:3.1: When the teaching is well explained,
sn46.17:3.3: are the ones who will cross over
sn46.17:3.4: Death’s domain so hard to pass.
sn46.17:4.2: an astute person should develop the bright.
sn46.17:4.4: for the seclusion so hard to enjoy,
sn46.17:5.1: you should try to find delight there,
sn46.17:5.3: With no possessions, an astute person
sn46.17:5.4: should cleanse themselves of mental corruptions.
sn46.17:6.1: And those whose minds are rightly developed
sn46.17:6.6: they are extinguished in this world.”
